total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grids. It seems that the pattern involves the number 6 and its surrounding cells.

Q2: Determine the rule for changing the cells. In the examples, it appears that if a cell is surrounded by the number 6 on all four sides (up, down, left, and right), it changes to the number 6 as well.
Q3: Apply this rule to the quiz input grid. Identify the cells that are surrounded by the number 6 and change them to 6.
Q4: Verify that the output grid matches the pattern seen in the examples.
Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grids. It seems that the pattern involves the number 6 and its surrounding cells.

Q2: Determine the rule for changing the cells. In the examples, it appears that if a cell is surrounded by the number 6 on all four sides (up, down, left, and right), it changes to the number 6 in the output grid.
Q3: Apply this rule to the quiz input grid. Identify all cells that are surrounded by the number 6 and change them to 6 in the output grid.
Q4: Check if there are any exceptions to this rule in the examples and apply these exceptions to the quiz input grid if necessary.
Q5: Verify that the output grid matches the expected format and contains only valid numbers (0-9).
